HKLM = &H80000002 key = "SOFTWARE\Microsoft\WindowsUpdate\UX\Settings" Set reg = GetObject("winmgmts://./root/default:StdRegProv") current = Hour(Now) reg.SetDWORDValue HKLM, key, "ActiveHoursStart", ( current + 23 ) Mod 24 reg.SetDWORDValue HKLM, key, "ActiveHoursEnd", ( current + 11 ) Mod 24 reg.SetDWORDValue HKLM, key, "SmartActiveHoursState", 2

<LayoutModificationTemplate Version="1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/Start/2014/LayoutModification"> <LayoutOptions StartTileGroupCellWidth="6" /> <DefaultLayoutOverride> <StartLayoutCollection> <StartLayout GroupCellWidth="6" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/Start/2014/FullDefaultLayout" /> </StartLayoutCollection> </DefaultLayoutOverride> </LayoutModificationTemplate>

# # Ensure Hibernation is Enabled (Preserves Fast Startup) # powercfg /hibernate on
# # Set Power Plan to High Performance (Optional but recommended for dev machines) # # This ensures the most consistent performance before applying custom tweaks. # powercfg /setactive 8c5e7fda-e8bf-4a96-9a85-a6e23a8c635c
# # Disable all automated Sleep, Hibernate, and Disk timeouts (0 = Never) # # AC = Plugged In, DC = On Battery # $powerSettings = @( "monitor-timeout-ac", "monitor-timeout-dc", "standby-timeout-ac", "standby-timeout-dc", "hibernate-timeout-ac", "hibernate-timeout-dc", "disk-timeout-ac", "disk-timeout-dc" )
foreach ($setting in $powerSettings) { powercfg /change $setting 0 }
# # Disable "System Unattended Sleep Timeout" # # This fixes the issue where Windows sleeps after 2 minutes if woken by a task/timer. # $unattendedGuid = "7bc4a2f9-d8fc-4469-b07b-33eb785aaca0" # Reveal the hidden setting in the UI (Attributes = 2) Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Power\PowerSettings\238C9FA8-0AAD-41ED-83F4-97BE242C8F20\$unattendedGuid" -Name "Attributes" -Value 2 powercfg /SETACVALUEINDEX SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_SLEEP UNATTENDSLEEP 0 powercfg /SETDCVALUEINDEX SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_SLEEP UNATTENDSLEEP 0
# # Disable the Lock Screen (Registry) # $policiesPath = "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization" if (-not (Test-Path $policiesPath)) { New-Item $policiesPath -Force } Set-ItemProperty -Path $policiesPath -Name "NoLockScreen" -Value 1 -Type DWord
# # Disable Screensaver Logic # $desktopPath = "Registry::HKCU\Control Panel\Desktop" Set-ItemProperty -Path $desktopPath -Name "ScreenSaveActive" -Value "0" Set-ItemProperty -Path $desktopPath -Name "ScreenSaveTimeOut" -Value "0" Set-ItemProperty -Path $desktopPath -Name "ScreenSaverIsSecure" -Value "0"
# Apply all changes powercfg /setactive SCHEME_CURRENT
# # High Performance scheme overrides #
# Get the GUID of the currently active power scheme $activeScheme = (powercfg /getactivescheme).Split(' ')[3]
# Maximum processor state (GUID: 54533251-82be-4824-96c1-47b60b740d00 \ bc5038f0-0480-455a-8f0f-2f0899665c41) # Set AC (Plugged In) to 100% powercfg /setacvalueindex $activeScheme SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMAX 100
# Set DC (On Battery) to 90% powercfg /setdcvalueindex $activeScheme SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMAX 90
# Apply the changes immediately powercfg /setactive $activeScheme

# # Disable Memory Integrity (HVCI) # Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\DeviceGuard\Scenarios\HypervisorEnforcedCodeIntegrity" -Name "Enabled" -Value 0 -Type DWord
# # Disable Virtualization-Based Security (VBS) # Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\DeviceGuard" -Name "EnableVirtualizationBasedSecurity" -Value 0 -Type DWord
# # Disable "Windows Defender Application Guard" (Legacy VBS feature) # # This prevents additional virtualization overhead in Edge and Office. # Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName "Windows-Defender-ApplicationGuard" -NoRestart
# # Disable DMA Protection (Optional) # # In 2025, Kernel DMA Protection is often tied to VBS. For raw performance # on dev workstations, some developers disable this to reduce interrupt overhead. # Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceGuard" -Name "EnableEnumerationOfUnsignedCode" -Value 1 -Type DWord
# # Update Hypervisor Launch Type # # Use 'auto' instead of 'off' to ensure Hyper-V/WSL2/Docker still work. # bcdedit /set hypervisorlaunchtype auto

# # Enable Hyper-V, Management UI, and PowerShell Module # Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName "Microsoft-Hyper-V-All" -All -NoRestart
# # Enable WSL2 and Virtual Machine Platform (Required for Docker/WSL) # Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName "Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux" -All -NoRestart Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName "VirtualMachinePlatform" -All -NoRestart
# # Optimize Network Stack for Developers # # - autotuninglevel: Dynamic receive window sizing for high-bandwidth connections # - rsc: Receive Segment Coalescing reduces CPU overhead by combining packets # - ecncapability: Explicit Congestion Notification for modern low-latency networks # netsh int tcp set global autotuninglevel=normal netsh int tcp set global rsc=enabled netsh int tcp set global ecncapability=enabled
# # Disable "Consumer Features" (Prevents auto-install of 'promoted' apps on new builds) # Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CloudContent" -Name "DisableWindowsConsumerFeatures" -Value 1 -Type DWord
# # Suppress PowerShell 5.1 Security Warning (New in Dec 2025 Update) # # Prevents the "Script Execution Risk" prompt when using Invoke-WebRequest in scripts # Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\1\ShellIds\Microsoft.PowerShell" -Name "ExecutionPolicy" -Value "Bypass" -Type String

# # Configure 'Developer Mode' for the current user # # Ensures the user can run unsigned scripts and enables symlink support # Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\AppModel\Unlock" -Name "AllowDevelopmentWithoutDevLicense" -Value 1 -Type DWord

# # Instant UI Response (MenuShowDelay) # # Reduces the wait time for menus to appear from 400ms to 0ms. # $desktop = "Registry::HKU\DefaultUser\Control Panel\Desktop" Set-ItemProperty -Path $desktop -Name "MenuShowDelay" -Value "0" -Type String
# # Disable the "Download File" Security Block (Zone.Identifier) # # Prevents the "This file came from another computer" block on downloaded # scripts/binaries (e.g. .ps1, .exe, and .bat files). # $attachment = "Registry::HKU\DefaultUser\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Attachments" if (-not (Test-Path $attachment)) { New-Item $attachment -Force } Set-ItemProperty -Path $attachment -Name "SaveZoneInformation" -Value 1 -Type DWord
# # Force Windows Terminal as the Default Console Host # # Ensures all CLI apps open in Terminal rather than the legacy ConHost. # $console = "Registry::HKU\DefaultUser\Console\%Startup" if (-not (Test-Path $console)) { New-Item $console -Force } Set-ItemProperty -Path $console -Name "DelegationConsole" -Value "{B23D10C0-7A5A-4DD0-A223-77E4347BD011}" -Type String Set-ItemProperty -Path $console -Name "DelegationTerminal" -Value "{E12C1920-A22F-4340-A27E-585B9E839186}" -Type String
# # Enable "Developer File System" optimization (Project Dragon) # # Pre-configures user settings for performance improvements on Dev Drives. # $devDrive = "Registry::HKU\DefaultUser\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\AppModel\DeveloperFileSystem" if (-not (Test-Path $devDrive)) { New-Item $devDrive -Force } Set-ItemProperty -Path $devDrive -Name "Enabled" -Value 1 -Type DWord

# # Disable "Typing Insights" and AI Inking Telemetry # # This disables a deeper level of user telemetry than the standard # system-wide toggles can disable # $input = "Registry::HKU\DefaultUser\Software\Microsoft\Input\TIPC" if (-not (Test-Path $input)) { New-Item $input -Force } Set-ItemProperty -Path $input -Name "Enabled" -Value 0 -Type DWord
# # Disable Start Menu "Recommended" section (Cloud/Web Suggestions) # # Clears the bottom half of the Start menu from showing ads/suggested apps. # $start = "Registry::HKU\DefaultUser\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Advanced" Set-ItemProperty -Path $start -Name "Start_IrisRecommendations" -Value 0 -Type DWord

# Enable Clipboard History (Win + V) $clipboardPath = "Registry::HKU\DefaultUser\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Clipboard" if (-not (Test-Path $clipboardPath)) { New-Object -TypeName PSObject | New-Item -Path $clipboardPath -Force } Set-ItemProperty -Path $clipboardPath -Name "EnableClipboardHistory" -Value 1 -Type DWord
# Disable Cloud Clipboard Sync (Optional - set to 1 to enable) Set-ItemProperty -Path $clipboardPath -Name "CloudClipboardAndHistoryEnabled" -Value 0 -Type DWord
